ASK ME Extension

"R" software is free software that can do pretty much what SAS can.

"AID" - Turn your Information into Action

See Extension (External link) or browse below

Material developed by UC Davis in collaboration with over 20 partner organizations.

Developing a program

The "ASK ME" Framework for Extension "TIGRS" keys for success

A = Audience and Needs S = Solutions K = Key message

M = Message form and delivery E = Evaluation

"ASK ME" Info sheet (UC Davis)

T = Trust in the message and the messenger

I = Integrated approaches Engage farmers

GR = Good Recommendations Credible, Relevant (Demand-driven), Clear benefit, Testable

S = “Seeing is believing”

TIGRS Fact Sheet (UC Davis)

  • A = Audience and Needs. "Who are they? What do they need and want?"

    Field Diagnostics Assessing needs
    • Tools to help identify problems:
      • Cereals: Maize Doctor (CIMMYT) ; Rice Doctor (IRRI) ; Wheat Doctor (CIMMYT)
      • Fruits, Nuts and Vegetables: Hort Hospital (UC Davis)
      • Soils: Soil Doctor (UC Davis)
    • Assessing needs Fact sheet (UC Davis)
    • Needs and opportunity assessment (NOA) Fact sheet (UC Davis)
    • Gathering secondary data Fact sheet (UC Davis)
      • Crop management survey sheet (UC Davis)
      • SWOC analysis Fact sheet
    • Choosing partners
    		 Working with groups
    • Audience Analysis Fact sheet (UC Davis)
    • Choosing Partners Fact sheet (UC Davis and BIID)
    • Forming Workgroups Fact sheet (UC Davis)
    • Building Trust Fact Sheet (UC Davis and Purdue)
    • Running farmer meetings Fact sheet (UC Davis)
    • Running farmer focus groups Fact sheet (UC Davis)
    • Managing (more formal) meetings Fact sheet (UC Davis)
    • Facilitation Fact sheet (UC Davis)
    • Building Consensus Fact sheet (UC Davis)
    • Conflict Resolution Fact sheet (UC Davis)

= Solutions. "What is practical and relevant to meet the needs?"

    • Evaluate solutions Fact Sheet (UC Davis)
    • Recommendation Domains - helping ensure a technology fit Fact sheet (UC Davis)
    • Evaluating technology options Fact sheet or Trainer exercise (UC Davis)
      • To compile technology options on-line, see Knowledge Bank Manual (UC Davis)
    • See sample Knowledge Banks e-Afghan Ag ; Cereal knowledge Bank ;

K = Key message. "What do people need to know to make the change?"

    • Identifying the key message Fact sheet (UC Davis)

M = Message form and delivery. "How can the message be best packaged and delivered?"
